Notes: The Morgan County Archives, founded in 1995, is located in a renovated bank building in Decatur.   Holdings total approximately 1500 cubic feet of archival and manuscript materials including original estate and guardianship case files, birth and death ledgers, tax records dating from the 1920's, County Commission records, and newspapers.  Genealogical materials include census, family history and bible records; local church, school and town histories; and photographs.  Staff has been very active in accessioning records from the Probate Judge's office.  With help from volunteers the original estate/guardianship files have been flattened, foldered, indexed and made available to the public.  The reading room contains donated local research materials including family files, family histories, genealogical quarterlies and photographs.
Source of Repository Data: Alabama Department of Archives and History
